column2: KENTUCKY PERMIT TEST
column4: Kentucky
column6: KY

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. When you see this sign you should stop and:
column4: yield the right-of way to all vehicles coming from the left.
column6: check traffic in all direction before proceeding.
column8: check for vehicles in the opposite direction, then proceed.

column2: 2. If the roadway is wet, you should:
column4: maintain the same speed.
column6: reduce your speed.
column8: increase your speed.

column2: 3. This road sign means:
column4: No left turn
column6: No right turn
column8: No U-turns

column2: 4. Your license can be suspended if you are under 21 and drive with a BAC of:
column4: any amount.
column6: 0.08% or more.
column8: 0.15% or more.

column2: 5. This signal means:
column4: Stop
column6: Move to the left
column8: Slow down

column2: 6. To avoid becoming an aggressive driver, you should:
column4: relax and concentrate on driving.
column6: drive above the posted speed limit.
column8: tailgate the driver in front of you.

column2: 7. Double solid lines on the roadway mean:
column4: you can not go across the lines except to turn left to enter or leave the highway.
column6: you cannot pass.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 8. If a pedestrian is illegal crossing in the middle of the street (not at a crosswalk) you:
column4: must stop for them.
column6: should increase your speed, honk your horn and proceed.
column8: do not have to stop for them.

column2: 9. A steady yellow light means:
column4: Drive with caution.
column6: Be prepared to stop for the red light.
column8: Be prepared to go. The light will soon be green.

column2: 10. You want to turn left at an intersection ahead. A car reaches the intersection from the opposite direction and moves straight ahead. You:
column4: can turn left. You have the right of way.
column6: may not enter the intersection to prepare for your left turn if the light is green.
column8: must wait for the car to go through before you turn.

column2: 11. When there is a potential for animals standing on the roadway, you should:
column4: slow down and use flashers or a headlight signal to scare the animals away.
column6: slow down and proceed with caution.
column8: honk your horn to scare the animals away.

column2: 12. When using hand-to-hand steering, you left hand should be placed on the steering wheel between __________ , and your right hand between ________ .
column4: 9 and 10 o’clock; 1 and 2 o’clock.
column6: 10 and 11 o’clock; 2 and 3 o’clock.
column8: 7 and 8 o’clock; 4 and 5 o’clock.

column2: 13. Excessive speed:
column4: helps you to maneuver around obstacles.
column6: increases the likelihood of serious bodily injuries and death.
column8: saves time so you can get to your destination more quickly.

column2: 14. When you hear the warning signal or see the warning lamps of an emergency vehicle, you must:
column4: stop as quickly as you can.
column6: drive slowly until the emergency vehicle has passed.
column8: provide a clear path for the emergency vehicle and stop.

column2: 15. Diamond-shaped signs:
column4: are used to warn of hazards on roadways.
column6: typically provide guidance to drivers.
column8: indicate no pass zones.

column2: 16. To avoid hydroplaning, drivers should:
column4: apply the brakes firmly.
column6: drive at a constant speed.
column8: slow down.

column2: 17. More than one vehicle is approaching a four-way stop sign. Who has the right of way?
column4: The driver on the left.
column6: The last driver to reach the intersection.
column8: The first driver to reach the intersection and stop.

column2: 18. A red traffic sign means?
column4: Construction warning.
column6: Stop.
column8: Railroad crossing.

column2: 19. Does a vehicle prepared to enter a traffic circle or rotary have right-of-way over vehicles in the circle?
column4: Yes.
column6: Yes, but only if they are entering the rotary from the right lane.
column8: No. Vehicles already in the circle have the right-of-way.

column2: 20. When drivers see the ‘Wrong Way’ sign:
column4: they must not leave the pavement except in an emergency.
column6: they are going the wrong way on an expressway exit ramp.
column8: they must drive past this sign and reach the next intersection.

column2: 21. On average, how long does it take your body to remove the alcohol contained in 5 ounces of wine?
column4: 3 hours.
column6: 30 minutes.
column8: one hour.

column2: 22. When preparing to exit an expressway, drivers should start reducing their speed:
column4: immediately upon entering the deceleration lane.
column6: at least 100 feet before entering the deceleration lane.
column8: about halfway through the deceleration lane.

column2: 23. When driving at night with no other vehicles ahead, a driver should use:
column4: low-beam lights.
column6: parking lights.
column8: high beam lights.

column2: 24. This sign warns drivers of:
column4: a narrow bridge ahead.
column6: low clearance.
column8: a low place in the road.

column2: 25. This sign means:
column4: The road will curve to the right.
column6: Left turns are not allowed at the intersection.
column8: Do not turn right.

column2: 26. Your car stalls on the tracks at a railroad crossing, and a collision with a train is imminent. After getting yourself and your passengers out of the car, you should:
column4: signal the train to stop.
column6: run toward the train but stay off the tracks.
column8: cross the tracks.

column2: 27. What does it mean If an oncoming driver flashes headlights at you during a period of low visibility?
column4: Your headlights are too bright. You should turn them off.
column6: Your vehicle was difficult to see. You should turn on your headlights.
column8: Your headlights are too bright. You should use parking lights instead.

column2: 28. While inside the roundabout, you should:
column4: remain in your lane until you are ready to exit.
column6: use your left turn signal if you are in position to exit now.
column8: change lanes before you check for vehicles behind you.

column2: 29. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: they will soon be facing oncoming traffic.
column6: they cannot go straight ahead.
column8: a shared lane starts ahead.

column2: 30. What should you do if you see smoke come from under the hood?
column4: Call the fire department and then pull off the road and park your vehicle.
column6: Try to fight the fire yourself.
column8: Pull off the road and park your vehicle. Turn off the ignition, get away from the car and call the fire department.

column2: 31. This road sign means the road you're driving on:
column4: turns sharply to the left and then right
column6: turns only to the left
column8: turns to the right and then the left

column2: 32. Green and white signs:
column4: warn drivers of unexpected road conditions.
column6: give information about directions and distances.
column8: are mainly used at intersections and driveways.

column2: 33. One broken line indicates:
column4: You can pass other vehicles and change lanes, if it is safe.
column6: You can change lanes, but only when traffic conditions or obstructions in the road make it necessary.
column8: You can not pass other vehicles or go across the line.

column2: 34. What is the first thing to do when you make a three-point turn?
column4: Signal with your left turn signal, then check carefully for traffic coming toward you.
column6: Signal with your right turn signal, then pull over to the right and stop.
column8: Turn left, go across the road so you come to a stop while you face the edge of the road.

column2: 35. This road sign means:
column4: You must turn right
column6: No right turn
column8: Steep downgrade

column2: 36. This sign means:
column4: Detour to the right
column6: The road to the right is for one-way traffic only
column8: Not enter

column2: 37. Always stop before you cross railroad tracks when:
column4: you are following a bicyclist or motorcyclist across railroad tracks.
column6: you are not wearing safety belts.
column8: you don't have room on the other side to completely cross the tracks.

column2: 38. If two vehicles reach the intersection at the same time:
column4: The first vehicle to reach the intersection has the right-of-way.
column6: The vehicle on the left yields to the vehicle on the right.
column8: The vehicle on the right yields to the vehicle on the left.

column2: 39. If you've had a few beers, the effects of alcohol will be reduced only by:
column4: getting a cup of coffee.
column6: taking a cold shower.
column8: waiting several hours.

column2: 40. This road sign warns drivers that:
column4: they are coming to a point where another traffic lane joins the one they are on.
column6: the one-way street or roadway is about to change to two-way traffic.
column8: a divided highway is ahead.
